intro: Tupistra albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bell-shaped, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soil, preferring cool and humid conditions. Its ornamental value lies in its elegant flowers and compact growth habit, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Tupistra albiflora is also valued for its ability to thrive in shaded environments, enhancing its versatility in landscaping.
